results.title: Spring
results.brief_description: Provides a series of visual impressions illustrating spring. Shows bare trees bursting into leaf, buds into flower and a profusion of colour appearing in gardens. No narration.

results.title: Spotty: the fawn in winter
results.brief_description: Shows Spotty the fawn as he sees his first snow in the forest, and describes how a little girl who puts out food for the animals helps Spotty survive his first winter.

results.title: Spotty: story of a fawn
results.brief_description: The story of the adventures of a wild fawn is used to foster a love of nature and outdoor life among young children. The film was shot in the natural environment of the fawn in the woods of North America and is aimed at stimulating oral and written language development at the kindergarten level.

results.title: Spotlight on smoking
results.brief_description: Graphs show the increase in public smoking and the marked decrease in smoking among doctors. Diagrams show what happens when smoke enters the breathing tubes and the alarming process of uncontrolled cell division which leads to cancer. Shows how mice can suffer from cancer, by painting cigarette tar on their skin. Leading personalities tell why they have given up smoking. Shows what can be bought with the money saved by giving up cigarettes over a year.

results.title: Spot news
results.brief_description: Speed is the life blood of the newspaper - by train, telegraph, telephone or radio. Reporters are covering a story of an aeroplane stunt. The reporter takes a photo, its developed in the van they are driving, and then sent via wire to the office.

results.title: Sports medicine
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: In the past two decades, performances in sport have improved greatly. Athletes are running faster, jumping longer and higher and have more endurance. It is mainly due to the increasing application of science through the result of devising better methods and longer periods of training. This scientific and systematic approach to getting fit and keeping fit is called Sports Medicine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Sporting scooters
results.brief_description: In the fifties, Italian manufacturers captured the unique style of the scooter with Vespa and Lambretta. Their approach to manufacturing scooters proved hugely popular. This programme take a nostalgic look at the fun enjoyed by many scooter enthusiasts of this time. It includes footage from the fifties of rallys, races and other scooter sports throughout Great Britain.
